channel.title: What to do?
channel.description:
ok this is suppost to be the floor for my first city and i wanted the floor to be like a sandy look but for some reason when i add in the tiles they look terrible in my opinion i wanted them to be flat solid color but its not working out how i want it to. whats yalls opinions and thoughts? like is it really that bad or am i just being to picky
[img]http://img541.imageshack.us/img541/7927/ysel.png[/img]

item.title: What to do?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:8, topic:524715”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=643371.msg4330800#msg4330800 date=1373635393]

It’s bad. No offense but that looks awful atm.

I’d have a look at object shading or maybe brightness?

If the model you imported doesn’t have those shadow like things at the corner, that is.

I attempted to mess with lighting but i think it actually has something to do with the client and how it makes shadows or lighting for objects or something with datmaker

Try to make a texture and put it on the object?

I don’t think textures(like lava, water, ect) have the same lighting effect.

Edit:

If you want, you could give me the model and the ints, I’ll add it and try to see if I can fix it.

how do you add textures to models in a pi?
[/quote]There used to be a link that showed you the long, tedious process. I can try to find it but I think it’s down.[/quote]

if you could thatd be awesome id really appreciate it ive been looking all morning for anything

or were you talking about this?
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/430842-galkons-adding-new-textures-noob-friendly.html

Read full topic

Try to make a texture and put it on the object?

I don’t think textures(like lava, water, ect) have the same lighting effect.

Edit:

If you want, you could give me the model and the ints, I’ll add it and try to see if I can fix it.

item.title: What to do?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

See if changing the material’s settings to Specular: 0 and Emission: 1 helps at all.

Read full topic

it reminds me of the grand exchange, it looks like granite tiles or something
